bibl.title: Yaichiro Goto v. Henry M. White. Order for Disbursment of Funds
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: In the District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington
In the Matter of the Application of YAICHIRO GOTO, otherwise known as YAICHIRO KATSUO, for Writ of Habeas Corpus.

It appearing to the Court from the records and files herein, and from the assignments hereto attached that E. P. Donnellyhhas, by order of this Honorable Court deposite the sum of Fifty Dollars ($50.00) with the clerk of court to cover the board and keep of the petitioner from the 1st day of April, 1921, and it further appearing to the court that of this sum the amount of Fifteen Dollars & 12/100 ($15.12) should be paid to the immigration commissioner as and for the Keep of said alien from the 1st day of April, to the 22nd day of April, 1921 inclusive, and that the balance of Thirty-four & 88/100 ($34.88) Dollars is due to E. P. Donnelly, attorney for the petitioner, and it further appearing to the court that the writ of prohibition has been denied, and that the case is finally terminated and that the alien Yaichiro Goto was deported on the 22nd day of April, 1921. NOW THEREFORE:

IT IS ORDERED, ADJUDGED AND DECREED: That F. M. Harshberger, Clerk of this court be, and he hereby is directed and ordered to distribute the sum of Fifty Dollars ($50.00) heretofore deposited in this case in the following manner: Thirty-four & 88/100 ($34.88) to E. P. Donnelly, and Fifteen & 12/100 Dollars ($15.12) to the commissioner of immigration or someone in this behalf W. H Gan. Heeding Contractor U.S. Immigration and said clerk is hereby ordered to pay said amounts immediately on signing of this order.
DONE IN OPEN COURT this 26th day of April, 1921
